On August 1, 986, Emperor Kazan left the Imperial Palace for good in order to become a Buddhist monk, and subsequently Emperor Ichijo was enthroned in his seventh year (it is said that this was a conspiracy by Kaneie set up a grandchild for enthronement at an early age).

sen.e: After Kaneie died, his eldest son, FUJIWARA no Michitaka became regent and kanpaku (chief adviser) to the Emperor as his maternal relatives, and FUJIWARA no Teishi became Emperor ICHIJO's second consort; however, he died in 995.

After Kaneie died, his eldest son, FUJIWARA no Michitaka, became regent and kampaku to the Emperor as his maternal relative, and FUJIWARA no Teishi became Emperor Ichijo's second consort; however, in 995 he died.

sen.j: 代わりに弟の藤原道兼が関白に就任するがわずか7日後に没し、道隆の子藤原伊周との争いに勝利した道隆・道兼の弟藤原道長が、姉で天皇の生母・詮子の推挙を受け、内覧となって実権を掌握した。
sen.e: After Michitaka's death, his brother FUJIWARA no Michikane became Kanpaku/chief adviser to the Emperor, but he also died after seven days, FUJIWARA no Michinaga, Michitaka and Michikane's brother, who won power struggle with Michitaka's son, FUJIWARA no Korechika, became Nairan/Chief secretary and took power after receiving his sister and Emperor's mother, Shoshi's recommendation.

sen.e: After Michitaka's death, his brother FUJIWARA no Michikane became kanpaku (chief adviser) to the Emperor, but he died just seven days later; FUJIWARA no Michinaga, Michitaka and Michikane's brother, who won the power struggle with Michitaka's son, FUJIWARA no Korechika, became nairan (chief secretary) and took power after receiving his sister and the Emperor's mother, at Shoshi's recommendation.

After Michitaka's death, his brother FUJIWARA no Michikane became kanpaku to the Emperor, but he died just seven days later; FUJIWARA no Michinaga, Michitaka and Michikane's brother, who had won the power struggle with Michitaka's son FUJIWARA no Korechika, became nairan (chief secretary) and took power after receiving the recommendation of his sister and the Emperor's mother, Shoshi.

sen.j: 道長は先に中宮であった定子を皇后とし、娘の藤原彰子（しょうし）を中宮に立てて、一帝二后の先例を開いた。
sen.e: Michinaga married to Shoshi and she became an Empress, who was previously second consort of an emperor, their daughter FUJIWARA no Shoshi, this was the first example of Ittei nigo.

sen.e: Michinaga married Shoshi and became an Empress, though she was previously the second consort of the Emperor, and had their daughter FUJIWARA no Shoshi; this was the first example of Ittei nigo.

Michinaga set the precedent for Ittei-Nigo (an emperor having two empresses) when he made Teishi, who was the second consort of the emperor at the time, empress, and made his daughter, FUJIWARA no Shoshi, the new second consort.

sen.j: 一条天皇の時代は道隆・道長兄弟のもとで藤原氏の権勢が最盛に達し、皇后定子に仕える清少納言、中宮彰子に仕える紫式部・和泉式部らによって平安女流文学が花開いた。
sen.e: While Emperor ICHIJO's enthronement, FUJIWARA clan was in their prime under Michitaka, Michinaga brothers supervision, Heian culture bloomed with Seishonagon who served Empress Shoshi and Murasakishikibu, Izumishikibu who both served Chugu Shoshi.

sen.e: While Emperor ICHIJO's enthronement, the FUJIWARA clan was in its prime under Michitaka, Michinaga brothers supervision, the Heian culture flourished with Seishonagon (who served Empress Shoshi and Murasakishikibu) and Izumishikibu, both of whom served Chugu Shoshi.

With Emperor Ichijo's enthronement, the FUJIWARA clan was in its prime under the supervision of Michitaka, Michinaga's brother; meanwhile, the Heian culture flourished with Seishonagon (who served Empress Teishi) and Murasakishikibu and Izumishikibu, both of whom served Chugu Shoshi.

sen.j: また、天皇が道長を関白とせずに内覧に留めたのは、天皇自身が長ずるにつれ、曽祖父の醍醐天皇・祖父の村上天皇のように、摂政関白を置かずに親政する事を志したのと、道長自身も、当時閣議に出られない決まりがある摂政関白よりも、内覧を兼ねたまま一上（閣員の首座）として実権を掌握しようとした事が一致した為で、これにより、後に大江匡房が『続本朝往生伝』で藤原実資や藤原行成等の有能な人材を輩出したと称えたほど、有為な政治体制が確立した。
sen.e: The Emperor decided Michinaga to be Nairan/chief secretary instead of Kampaku/chief adviser to the Emperor, as he got older, since he wished to run the government directly instead of having regent and Kampaku, like his great grandfather, Emperor DAIGO and his grandfather, Emperor MURAKAMI, on the other hand Michinaga agreed to be Nairan and also the top of various section to control the government, as regent and Kampaku do not have a right to attend the Cabinet meeting, thus the strong political framework was set up and OE no Masahusa honored in "Zoku Honcho Ojoden" that talented people like FUJIWARA no Sanesuke and FUJIWARA no Yukinari were produced.
sen.cmt: 醍醐天皇 Emperor DAIGO, 村上天皇 Emperor MURAKAMI, 大江匡房 OE no Masahusa 定訳不明,『続本朝往生伝』"Zoku Honcho Ojoden", 一上 chief member of the cabinet 定訳不明, 藤原実資 FUJIWARA no Sanesuke and 藤原行成 FUJIWARA no Yukinari
sen.e: The Emperor decided Michinaga to be nairan (chief secretary) instead of kampaku (chief adviser) to the Emperor, as he got older, since he wanted to run the government directly instead of having a regent and kampaku, like his great-grandfather, Emperor DAIGO and his grandfather, Emperor MURAKAMI; on the other hand, Michinaga agreed to be nairan and also the top of various sections to control the government, as the regent and kampaku weren't entitled to attend the meetings of the Cabinet; thus the strong political framework was set up and OE no Masahusa acknowledged through "Zoku Honcho Ojoden" that talented people like FUJIWARA no Sanesuke and FUJIWARA no Yukinari were produced.

The Emperor decided that Michinaga would be nairan (chief secretary) instead of kampaku (chief adviser) to the Emperor, once he became older, since he wanted to run the government directly instead of having a regent and kampaku, like his great-grandfather Emperor Daigo and his grandfather, Emperor MurakamiI; on the other hand, Michinaga agreed to be nairan and also the head of various sections to control the government, since the regent and kampaku weren't entitled to attend the meetings of the Cabinet; thus a strong political framework was set up and OE no Masahusa acknowledged through "Zoku Honcho Ojoden," with which talented people like FUJIWARA no Sanesuke and FUJIWARA no Yukinari were produced.

sen.j: その一方で、鎌倉時代初期に書かれた道長の6代目の子孫にあたる慈円の著した『愚管抄』によれば、天皇の死後道長は天皇の遺品の中に一通の手紙を発見し、その中には「三光明ならんと欲し、重雲を覆ひて大精暗し」と書かれていて、これを「道長の専横によって国は乱れている」という意味に解した道長はその文を焼き捨てたという一件がある。
sen.e: On the other hand, according to "Gukan-sho" which was written in early Kamakura period, by Jien who is Michinaga's 6th descendent, Michinaga found a letter in Emperor's memento saying 'one person tried to have all the power to himself, therefore the world is covered by the clouds and people are unhappy', Michinaga burned this letter as he took it as saying, 'Because of Michinaga's own way of ruling the government, the world is not in peace.'

sen.e: On the other hand, according to "Gukan-sho," which was written early in the Kamakura period by Jien, who was Michinaga's sixth descendent, Michinaga found a letter in the Emperor's mementos saying that 'one person tried to have all the power to himself, therefore the world is covered by clouds and people are unhappy'; Michinaga burned this letter, since he took it as saying, 'Because of Michinaga's own way of ruling the government, the world is not in peace.'

On the other hand, according to "Gukan-sho," which was written early in the Kamakura period by Jien, who was Michinaga's sixth descendent, Michinaga found a letter in the Emperor's mementos saying that 'one person tried to have all the power to himself, therefore the world is covered by clouds and people are unhappy'; Michinaga burned this letter, since he took it as saying, 'Because of Michinaga's own way of ruling the government, the world is not in peace.'
